  <!-- Header -->
  <div style="background: linear-gradient(135deg, #0F172A 0%, #1E293B 100%); border-radius: 16px; padding: 32px; margin-bottom: 28px; text-align: center;">
    <div style="font-size: 48px; margin-bottom: 12px;">üí°</div>
    <div style="font-family: 'Courier New', Consolas, monospace; font-size: 11px; letter-spacing: 3px; color: #64748B; text-transform: uppercase; margin-bottom: 8px;">AI Skills Passport</div>
    <h1 style="font-family: 'Courier New', Consolas, monospace; font-size: 24px; font-weight: bold; color: #F1F5F9; margin: 0 0 8px 0; letter-spacing: 1px;">KEY TAKEAWAYS</h1>
    <p style="font-size: 15px; color: #94A3B8; margin: 0; line-height: 1.5;">The big ideas, even if you do nothing else. Eight principles worth knowing.</p>
  </div>

  <!-- Intro -->
  <div style="background: #16162A; border: 1px solid #2D2D4A; border-radius: 12px; padding: 24px; margin-bottom: 24px;">
    <p style="font-size: 15px; color: #94A3B8; line-height: 1.7; margin: 0;">Short on time? Overwhelmed by AI? That's fine. If you take nothing else from the AI Skills Passport, take these eight ideas. Each one comes with something you can try in two minutes.</p>
  </div>

  <!-- Accordion Grid -->
  <div class="kt-grid">

    <!-- 1: Conversation, Not Delegation -->
    <div class="kt-card">
      <button class="kt-header" aria-expanded="false">
        <span class="kt-icon">üí¨</span>
        <span class="kt-title">Conversation, Not Delegation</span>
        <span class="kt-chevron">&#9658;</span>
      </button>
      <div class="kt-body">
        <p class="kt-desc">Use AI as a thinking partner, not a vending machine. The value is in the back-and-forth ‚Äî refining your ideas, challenging assumptions, iterating on drafts. The conversation <em>is</em> the work.</p>
        <div class="kt-try">
          <div class="kt-try-label">Try this (2 min)</div>
          <p class="kt-try-text">Next time you use AI, don't accept the first response. Reply with "What did you assume?" or "What's the weakest part of this?" and see how the output improves.</p>
        </div>
        <a href="experiences/teaching-with-ai.html" class="kt-deeper">Go deeper: Working with AI ‚Üí</a>
      </div>
    </div>

    <!-- 2: Model the Behaviour You Expect -->
    <div class="kt-card">
      <button class="kt-header" aria-expanded="false">
        <span class="kt-icon">ü™û</span>
        <span class="kt-title">Model the Behaviour You Expect</span>
        <span class="kt-chevron">&#9658;</span>
      </button>
      <div class="kt-body">
        <p class="kt-desc">If you want students and colleagues to use AI thoughtfully, show them what that looks like. Share your process. Be transparent about when and how you used AI. Lead by example, not by policy alone.</p>
        <div class="kt-try">
          <div class="kt-try-label">Try this (2 min)</div>
          <p class="kt-try-text">Add a one-line note to your next document or email: "I used AI to help draft/check/summarise this." Notice how it changes the conversation.</p>
        </div>
        <a href="experiences/what-would-you-do.html" class="kt-deeper">Go deeper: What Would You Do? ‚Üí</a>
      </div>
    </div>

    <!-- 3: Help Students Navigate These New Times -->
    <div class="kt-card">
      <button class="kt-header" aria-expanded="false">
        <span class="kt-icon">üß≠</span>
        <span class="kt-title">Help Students Navigate These New Times</span>
        <span class="kt-chevron">&#9658;</span>
      </button>
      <div class="kt-body">
        <p class="kt-desc">Students need guidance, not prohibition. They're already using AI ‚Äî the question is whether they're using it well. Meet them where they are and help them develop judgement, not just compliance.</p>
        <div class="kt-try">
          <div class="kt-try-label">Try this (2 min)</div>
          <p class="kt-try-text">Ask a student how they're using AI right now. Listen without judgement. You'll learn more in two minutes than from any report.</p>
        </div>
        <a href="experiences/rules-of-engagement.html" class="kt-deeper">Go deeper: Rules of Engagement ‚Üí</a>
      </div>
    </div>

    <!-- 4: Learning with AI Is Still Learning -->
    <div class="kt-card">
      <button class="kt-header" aria-expanded="false">
        <span class="kt-icon">üß†</span>
        <span class="kt-title">Learning with AI Is Still Learning</span>
        <span class="kt-chevron">&#9658;</span>
      </button>
      <div class="kt-body">
        <p class="kt-desc">It's different from how you learned, but the thinking still happens. When a student uses AI to explore, question, and refine their understanding, the conversation is the evidence of learning. The process matters more than the product.</p>
        <div class="kt-try">
          <div class="kt-try-label">Try this (2 min)</div>
          <p class="kt-try-text">Pick a topic you know well. Ask AI to explain it, then critique the response. Notice how evaluating AI output requires genuine understanding.</p>
        </div>
        <a href="experiences/ai-proof-assessments.html" class="kt-deeper">Go deeper: AI-Proof Your Assessments ‚Üí</a>
      </div>
    </div>

    <!-- 5: AI Amplifies Thinking -->
    <div class="kt-card">
      <button class="kt-header" aria-expanded="false">
        <span class="kt-icon">üîä</span>
        <span class="kt-title">AI Amplifies Thinking</span>
        <span class="kt-chevron">&#9658;</span>
      </button>
      <div class="kt-body">
        <p class="kt-desc">AI doesn't replace thinking ‚Äî it amplifies it. Good input produces good output. Lazy input produces polished garbage. The quality of what you bring to the conversation determines the quality of what you get back.</p>
        <div class="kt-try">
          <div class="kt-try-label">Try this (2 min)</div>
          <p class="kt-try-text">Give AI a vague prompt, then rewrite it with specific context, audience, and purpose. Compare the two outputs. The difference is your thinking.</p>
        </div>
        <a href="experiences/teaching-with-ai.html" class="kt-deeper">Go deeper: Working with AI ‚Üí</a>
      </div>
    </div>

    <!-- 6: Keep a Human in the Loop -->
    <div class="kt-card">
      <button class="kt-header" aria-expanded="false">
        <span class="kt-icon">ü§ù</span>
        <span class="kt-title">Keep a Human in the Loop</span>
        <span class="kt-chevron">&#9658;</span>
      </button>
      <div class="kt-body">
        <p class="kt-desc">AI makes mistakes. It hallucinates, oversimplifies, and misses context. Your judgement, domain expertise, and accountability are what make it work. You're not optional ‚Äî you're essential.</p>
        <div class="kt-try">
          <div class="kt-try-label">Try this (2 min)</div>
          <p class="kt-try-text">Ask AI a factual question about your field. Fact-check one claim. You'll likely find something that's almost right but subtly wrong ‚Äî that's why you matter.</p>
        </div>
        <a href="experiences/is-this-ai.html" class="kt-deeper">Go deeper: Is This AI? ‚Üí</a>
      </div>
    </div>

    <!-- 7: Done Beats Perfect -->
    <div class="kt-card">
      <button class="kt-header" aria-expanded="false">
        <span class="kt-icon">üöÄ</span>
        <span class="kt-title">Done Beats Perfect</span>
        <span class="kt-chevron">&#9658;</span>
      </button>
      <div class="kt-body">
        <p class="kt-desc">You don't need to master AI before you use it. Try one thing. Get it wrong. Try again. The cost of waiting for certainty is higher than the cost of an imperfect start. Everyone who's confident with AI now started by fumbling through it.</p>
        <div class="kt-try">
          <div class="kt-try-label">Try this (2 min)</div>
          <p class="kt-try-text">Open any AI tool right now and ask it one question about something you're working on. Don't overthink the prompt. Just ask. See what happens.</p>
        </div>
        <a href="experiences/teaching-with-ai.html" class="kt-deeper">Go deeper: Working with AI ‚Üí</a>
      </div>
    </div>

    <!-- 8: Start with Your Own Voice -->
    <div class="kt-card">
      <button class="kt-header" aria-expanded="false">
        <span class="kt-icon">‚úçÔ∏è</span>
        <span class="kt-title">Start with Your Own Voice</span>
        <span class="kt-chevron">&#9658;</span>
      </button>
      <div class="kt-body">
        <p class="kt-desc">The best way to get AI output that sounds like you is to start with your own content. Give it your rough notes, your bullet points, your messy first draft. AI is far better at refining your thinking than generating from scratch ‚Äî and the result sounds like you, not like a machine.</p>
        <div class="kt-try">
          <div class="kt-try-label">Try this (2 min)</div>
          <p class="kt-try-text">Take something you've already written ‚Äî an email draft, meeting notes, a paragraph from a report. Paste it into AI and ask "Help me tighten this up." Compare the result to what you'd get from a blank prompt.</p>
        </div>
        <a href="experiences/teaching-with-ai.html" class="kt-deeper">Go deeper: Working with AI ‚Üí</a>
      </div>
    </div>

  </div>

  <!-- Accordion JS -->
  <script>
  (function() {
    var cards = document.querySelectorAll('.kt-card');
    cards.forEach(function(card) {
      var btn = card.querySelector('.kt-header');
      btn.addEventListener('click', function() {
        var wasOpen = card.classList.contains('is-expanded');
        cards.forEach(function(c) {
          c.classList.remove('is-expanded');
          c.querySelector('.kt-header').setAttribute('aria-expanded', 'false');
        });
        if (!wasOpen) {
          card.classList.add('is-expanded');
          btn.setAttribute('aria-expanded', 'true');
        }
      });
    });
  })();
  </script>
